quotes_list.quote: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
You don't get to choose not to pay a price, you only get to choose which price you pay
If you can't understand why someone is doing something, look at the consequences of their actions, whatever they might be, and then infer the motivations from their consequences.
If you want one thing too much itâ€™s likely to be a disappointment. The healthy way is to learn to like the everyday things, like soft beds and buttermilk and feisty gentlemen.

The two things I understand best are stand-up comedy and martial arts. And those things require an ultimate grasp of the truth. You have to be objective about your skills and abilities to compete in both.
